title: The Source
description: What's the story's intent? Investigate the site, its mission, and its contact info.

title: The Author
description: Do a quick search on the author. Are they credible? Are they real?

title: The Information
description: Read past click-baity headlines, note who is (or isn't) quoted, and verify the information on other sites.

title: Supporting Sources
description: Click on the supporting links, and perform reverse searches on the images. Are they credible, and do they support the story?

title: The URL
description: Be wary of unusual top-level domain names, like '.com.co' that are designed to appear legitimate.

title: Your Bias
description: Who is the intended audience for this story? Consider if your own beliefs could affect your judgment.

title: The Date
description: Reposting old news stories doesn't mean they're relevant to current events.

title: The Text
description: Does the article have spelling errors or dramatic punctuation? Reputable sources have high proofreading and grammatical standards.

title: The Experts
description: Would this story meet academic citation standards? Consult a fact-checking site.
